HTML Styles Previous Next The HTML style attribute is used to add styles to an element, such as color, font, size, and more. Example I am Red I am Blue I am Big Try it Yourself The HTML Style Attribute Setting the style of an HTML element, can be done with the style attribute. The HTML style attribute has the following syntax: < tagname style=" property : value; "> The property is a CSS property. The value is a CSS value. You will learn more about CSS later in this tutorial. Background Color The CSS background-color property defines the background color for an HTML element.
